instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with DFU Restore error
threads.message:
This Air board came from a machine with a bad battery. Trackpad clicks but nothing else happens. It enters DFU mode willingly. Restore ends with the error "The system cannot be restored on this device", see below.

Does the "Missing data volume" mean the SSD is not recognized or the T2 is bad?

threads.title: Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with DFU Restore error
threads.message:
Probably SSD issue.
However, not sure if even Apple has a clear description for DFU errors...
